alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 10:11PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Lower Yukon River from Graying downstream to the Yukon Delta and the Innoko River near Shageluk. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Backwater from ice jams between Russian Mission and the Yukon Delta as well as snowmelt has lead to extensive overbank flooding of lowlands on the Lower Yukon from Grayling through the Yukon River Delta, as well as the Innoko River at Shageluk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM AKDT Friday, water levels remain high from snowmelt and the recent ice jams. The USGS river gage at Pilot Station shows that the water has only dropped 1.7 feet since its crest on Friday May 26th. Satellite imagery confirms overland flooding along the Yukon and Innoko River. Water levels from Grayling downriver to the Yukon River Delta will remain high over the coming days. - For Yukon River at Pilot Station: At 9:00pm Friday the stage was 28.9 feet. The river crested at 30.6 feet on Friday May 26th. - http://weather.gov/aprfc
